original: gang snying rje chen po de la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: gang snying rje chen po de la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: They do not form mental constructs about great compassion, nor do they make it into a sign.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //🔽sems can gang gi don du snying rje chen po de la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do // sems can gang gi don du snying rje chen po de la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: “When they practice the distinct attributes of the buddhas, they do not form mental constructs about those distinct attributes of the buddhas, nor do they make them into a sign.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //🔽gang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa de dag la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: They do not form mental constructs about the cultivation of those distinct attributes of the buddhas, nor do they make them into a sign.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //

analyzed: sems can gang gi don du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa de dag la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog / mtshan mar mi byed de /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: They do not form mental constructs about the knowledge of all aspects, and they do not make it into a sign.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //🔽gang thams cad shes pa nyid de la sgom pa de la'ang mi rtog /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: and they do not make it into a sign.

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: and they do not make it into a sign.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /

analyzed: dngos @239b po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not pay attention to it as an existent thing or as a nonexistent thing.

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de la'ang mi rtog /
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba de la'ang mi rtog /
translated: They do not form mental constructs about the one who fully awakens, the one who fully awakens to what, and the one by means of which there is full awakening.

original: mtshan mar mi byed de /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi byed de /
translated: They do not make mental marks.

original: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa'am dngos po med par yang yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not pay attention to it as an existent thing or as a nonexistent thing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /

analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos rnams kyis kyang ma byas te /

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /

original: byed pa po med pa /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa /

original: byed pa po dang bral ba'o; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: byed pa po dang bral ba'o; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ltar lags na /
analyzed: de ltar lags na /

original: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /
analyzed: chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags sam /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /

original: rab 'byor / chos rnams ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos rnams ni /

original: chos rnams nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: are free from phenomena themselves.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

analyzed: gal te de ltar chos rnams chos rnams nyid dang bral ba lags na / ji ltar chos kyis chos la dngos po mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /

original: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis zhes bgyi bar yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur /
translated: how can one understand that phenomena exist or do not exist in phenomena?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ste /
translated: Blessed One,🔽a non-existent phenomenon cannot understand an existent phenomenon,

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: and an existent phenomenon cannot understand a non-existent phenomenon.”

original: dngos @240a *// po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung do //
analyzed: dngos @240a *// po ma mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po mchis pa'i chos yongs su 'tshal bar mi rung do //
translated: And it is not possible for a non-existent dharma to know an existent dharma.

original: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po mchis pa'i chos kyis kyang dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos 'tshal bar mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not possible for an existent dharma to know a non-existent dharma.

original: de ltar chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal pa ma mchis pas /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad yongs su 'tshal pa ma mchis pas /
translated: Thus, since all dharmas are unknowable,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lta dngos po mchis pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lta dngos po mchis pa'am /
translated: it is not possible for a bodhisattva great being to think about an existent or

original: dngos po ma mchis par sems par yang dag la 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis par sems par yang dag la 'gyur /
translated: non-existent dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i /
translated: who practice the perfection of wisdom

original: tshe 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nye bar bzung bas dngos po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar ston te /🔽don dam par ni /
analyzed: tshe 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob nye bar bzung bas dngos po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar ston te / don dam par ni /
translated: teach that ‘things exist’ or ‘things do not exist’ in terms of worldly convention.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: ci lags / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: “Is it that the conventional of the world is one thing,

original: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
analyzed: don dam pa'ang gzhan zhig lags sam /
translated: and the ultimate is another?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, it is not that the conventional of the world is one thing,

original: don dam par yang gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba'ang med de /
analyzed: don dam par yang gzhan zhig yin zhes bya ba'ang med de /
translated: and the ultimate is another.

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin yang /
translated: The suchness of the conventional of the world is just the suchness of the ultimate.

original: de la sems can de dag phyir ci log tu gyur pas de bzhin nyid de mi shes mi mthong ste /
analyzed: de la sems can de dag phyir ci log tu gyur pas de bzhin nyid de mi shes mi mthong ste /
translated: But those sentient beings, because of being mistaken, do not know and do not see that suchness.

original: de dag gis yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos @240b po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gis yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyis dngos @240b po yod ces bya ba'am dngos po med ces bya bar brjod do //
translated: They say, ‘The bodhisattva mahāsattva uses the conventional of the world to say that things exist or that things do not exist.’

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang sems can gang ji snyed cig phung po lnga la dngos po yod pa'i 'du shes su gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar yang sems can gang ji snyed cig phung po lnga la dngos po yod pa'i 'du shes su gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this: however many sentient beings have the idea that the five aggregates exist as things,

original: dngos po med par mi shes pa de dag gi don du chos rnam pa rab tu dbye ba nye bar bzung ste dngos po med par ji ltar shes par gyur zhes te de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po med par mi shes pa de dag gi don du chos rnam pa rab tu dbye ba nye bar bzung ste dngos po med par ji ltar shes par gyur zhes te de skad du brjod do //
translated: For the sake of those who do not know that things are not real, the differentiation of phenomena is taught, so that they may come to know that things are not real.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyad par bya'o //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: Subhūti, this is how bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: le'u lnga bcu bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifty-fourth chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi na /

analyzed: de skad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba de ni / de byang chub kyi don du spyad pas na /

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the bodhisattva practice.🔽Subhūti said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la spyod pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang la spyod pa lags /
translated: what do bodhisattva great beings practice?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who practice this awakening, who practice the perfection of giving, who practice the perfection of morality, who practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: who practice the perfection of perseverance, who practice the perfection of concentration, who practice the perfection of wisdom, who practice inner emptiness, who practice outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: who practice inner and outer emptiness, who practice the emptiness of emptiness, who practice great emptiness, who practice the emptiness of ultimate reality, who practice the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are those who practice the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of what is endless and beginningless, and the emptiness of nonrepudiation.🔽They are those who practice the emptiness of inherent characteristics, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonentities,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities. They are those who practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag @248a *//🔽rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag @248a *// rnams la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the bases of supernatural power, they practice the faculties, they practice the powers, they practice the branches of awakening,🔽they practice the noble eightfold path, they practice the noble truths, they practice the concentrations, they practice the immeasurables, they practice the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the eight deliverances, they practice the nine serial absorptions, they practice the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation,

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: They practice the superknowledges, they practice the meditative stabilizations, they practice the dhāraṇī gateways, they practice the powers of the tathāgatas, they practice fearlessness, they practice the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: byams pa chen po la spyod pa dang / snying rje chen po la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod pa dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: they practice the great love, they practice the great compassion, they practice the distinct attributes of a buddha, they practice the knowledge of all aspects, they practice the knowledge of path aspects,🔽and they practice the knowledge of all times.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa de la chos gang yang tshogs su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod pa de la chos gang yang tshogs su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: “What are the dharmas that they practice?

original: 'grib pa'am / 'gong ba'am /
analyzed: 'grib pa'am / 'gong ba'am /
translated: Are they dharmas that are accumulated or🔽are they dharmas that are diminished?

original: 'phel ba'am / skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'phel ba'am / skye ba'am /
translated: Are they dharmas that are produced or🔽are they dharmas that cease?

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: Are they dharmas that are defiled or

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: are they dharmas that are purified?”🔽“Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not practice any dharma at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @248b dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @248b dpa' chen po gang byang chub 'di la spyod pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: Subhuti, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who practice this enlightenment, who practice the perfection of giving, who practice the perfection of morality, who practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: who practice the perfection of vigor, who practice the perfection of meditation, who practice the perfection of wisdom, who practice inner emptiness, who practice outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /🔽'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are those who practice the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external and the internal, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities,🔽and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: They are the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa @249a *//
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod pa dang / dbang po rnams la spyod pa dang / stobs rnams la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod pa @249a *//
translated: the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment,

original: dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la spyod pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang /
translated: the noble eightfold path, the noble truths, the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la spyod pa dang /

translated: they practice the gateways to liberation, they practice the formless absorptions, they practice the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation,

translated: they practice the higher cognitions, they practice the meditative stabilizations, they practice the dhāraṇī gateways, they practice the powers of the tathāgatas, they practice the fearlessnesses, they practice the detailed and thorough knowledges,

translated: They do not practice the emptiness of ultimate reality with respect to duality.🔽They do not practice the emptiness of conditioned phenomena with respect to duality.🔽They do not practice the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena with respect to duality.

original: gnyis kyi mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis rang bzhin stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis chos @251b thams cad stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

original: gnyis kyis mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis yang dag par spong ba rnams la mi spyod do //

analyzed: gnyis kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la mi spyod do // gnyis kyis dbang po rnams la mi spyod do //

original: gnyis kyis stobs rnams la mi spyod do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis stobs rnams la mi spyod do //
translated: “They do not practice the powers as dual, nor do they practice them as nondual.

analyzed: gnyis kyis byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la mi spyod do //
translated: “They do not practice the branches of awakening as dual, nor do they practice them as nondual.

analyzed: gnyis kyis 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mi spyod do //

translated: The Lord:

analyzed: rab 'byor / su gang @253b gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who course in duality,

original: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, do not increase the roots of good.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /
translated: All foolish common people,

original: gnyis la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis la brten pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, course in duality.

original: de dag ni; dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par mi 'phel lo //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: de dag ni; dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par mi 'phel lo // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: They do not increase the roots of good.

original: gnyis la mi spyod de /🔽de ni / sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: gnyis la mi spyod de / de ni / sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: But the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not course in duality.🔽From the first thought of enlightenment onward he increases the roots of good,

original: sems phyi ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel te /
analyzed: sems phyi ma bskyed pa'i bar du dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel te /
translated: up to the last thought of enlightenment.

original: de ni / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis nyams smin pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: de ni / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang gis nyams smin pas nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: It is the root of nonvirtue for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, by which they fall to the śrāvaka level or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: the pratyekabuddha level.

original: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gyis yongs su 'phrogs par gyur cing /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos gzhan gyis yongs su 'phrogs par gyur cing /
translated: Or it is some other nonvirtuous dharma that takes them over.

original: de dag gis yongs su 'phrogs pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: de dag gis yongs su 'phrogs pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na / dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: And when they are taken over by those, they practice the perfection of giving,🔽but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways, they practice the perfection of morality,🔽but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways, they practice the perfection of patience,🔽but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways, they practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways, they practice the perfection of concentration,🔽but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways, they practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽but do not increase the wholesome roots in many ways.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: they do not increase wholesome roots.🔽When they practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: they do not increase wholesome roots.🔽When they practice inner emptiness,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam @254a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam @254a *//
translated: they do not increase wholesome roots.

original: par mi 'phel ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: par mi 'phel ba dang / nang stong pa nyid la spyod na / dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / phyi stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: When they practice outer emptiness,🔽they do not increase wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: When they practice inner and outer emptiness,🔽they do not increase wholesome roots.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: When they practice the emptiness of emptiness,🔽they do not increase wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / chen po stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: When they practice great emptiness,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod na / dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.🔽If they practice the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the emptiness of beyond extremes,🔽their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the emptiness of no beginning and no end,🔽their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the emptiness of no rejection,🔽their roots of virtue will not increase more and more.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la spyod na / @254b dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the emptiness of specific characteristics,🔽they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the emptiness of non-apprehension,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the emptiness of things,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la spyod na; dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la spyod na; dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the faculties,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / dbang po rnams la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue.🔽If they practice the powers,🔽they will not increase their roots of virtue.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / stobs rnams la spyod na dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the branches of awakening,🔽they will not increase their roots of virtue.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / tshad med pa rnams la spyod na /

translated: they do not increase wholesome roots.

analyzed: 'phel ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod na /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rnam par thar pa rnams la spyod na; dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod na /
translated: When they practice the serial absorptions,🔽they do not increase wholesome roots.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod na; dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the superknowledges,🔽they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the meditative stabilizations,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the dhāraṇī gateways,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the powers of the tathāgatas,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice fearlessness,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice the detailed and thorough knowledges,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / byams pa chen po la spyod na /
translated: they will not increase their roots of virtue. If they practice great love,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / snying rje chen po la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the perfection of perseverance, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the perfection of concentration, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the emptiness meditative stabilization, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the signless meditative stabilization, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the wishless meditative stabilization, they do not increase their wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod @255b na; dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / thams cad shes pa nyid la spyod na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la spyod na /

translated: If they practice the applications of mindfulness, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the right efforts, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the legs of miraculous power, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the faculties, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the powers, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the limbs of awakening, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the path, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the ten tathāgata powers, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the four fearlessnesses, they do not increase their wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod na /
translated: If they practice the four detailed and thorough knowledges, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice great compassion, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations, they do not increase their wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba de ltar nyams smad par mi nus te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang pos rnam par mi 'phel ba de ltar nyams smad par mi nus te /
translated: If they practice the ten tathāgata powers, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the four fearlessnesses, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the four detailed and thorough knowledges, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they do not increase their wholesome roots.🔽If they practice great compassion, they do not increase their wholesome roots.

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bya'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: If they practice the thirty-

original: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi'am /
analyzed: ci lags / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par bgyi'am /

translated: and without being taken hold of by spiritual friends, bodhisattva great beings cannot attain the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽“Lord, if bodhisattva great beings do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of wholesome roots, do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of unwholesome roots, and do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of neither wholesome roots nor unwholesome roots, Lord, for the sake of what do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom?”🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the nonproduction of wholesome roots and unwholesome roots.”🔽“Lord, how do bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the nonproduction of wholesome roots and unwholesome roots?”🔽“Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not see wholesome roots, do not see unwholesome roots, do not see the production of wholesome roots, do not see the production of unwholesome roots, do not see the nonproduction of wholesome roots, and do not see the nonproduction of unwholesome roots.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

translated: how do bodhisattva great beings who have served the blessed buddhas,

original: bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su bzung ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: who are sustained by roots of virtue, and who are sustained by spiritual friends attain omniscience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is because from the time when great bodhisattva beings first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, they serve the blessed buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang /
translated: and those blessed buddhas teach them the sūtras, the melodic verses, the prophecies, the verses, the aphorisms, the narratives, the parables,

original: shin tu rgyas pa dang / chos rmad du byang ba dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab pa bsten pa gang ci gsungs kyang de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin to //🔽yongs su bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su 'dris pa dang / yid kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / lta bas rab tu khong du chud par byas shing gzungs rab tu thob par byed do //🔽gzungs rab tu thob nas so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed do //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa dang / chos rmad du byang ba dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab pa bsten pa gang ci gsungs kyang de dag thams cad yongs su 'dzin to // yongs su bzung nas kyang tshig gis yongs su 'dris pa dang / yid kyis shin tu brtags pa dang / lta bas rab tu khong du chud par byas shing gzungs rab tu thob par byed do // gzungs rab tu thob nas so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed do //
translated: Whatever is said in the sutras, whether in verse or prose, whether in brief or in detail, whether it is of his own realization or spoken for the sake of others, he takes up all of it.🔽Having taken it up, he becomes familiar with it through recitation, examines it with his mind, and penetrates it with insight, thus attaining retention.🔽Having attained retention, he generates the analytical knowledges.🔽

original: de @256b bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: de @256b bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung na /
translated: “If they plant wholesome roots in those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, and are sustained by those wholesome roots,

original: nam yang ngan song dang mi khom par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang ngan song dang mi khom par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be reborn in the lower existences or in the unfortunate states.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang lus yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis kyang lus yongs su dag pa yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Those wholesome roots will also cause them to acquire a pure body.

original: lus de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do /
analyzed: lus de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do /
translated: With those bodies they will purify a buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung bas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i legs pa ston pa dag dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do // dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis yongs su bzung bas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i legs pa ston pa dag dang /
translated: They will bring beings to maturity.

original: nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam du'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Sustained by those wholesome roots, they will never be separated from the spiritual benefactors, the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, and those who teach the excellence of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽“

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, should the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom attend on the lord buddhas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed par bya'o //
translated: They should produce wholesome roots.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: They should rely on spiritual friends.

original: le'u lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifty-fifth chapter, “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,” of the “Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya re drug pa //
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya re drug pa //
translated: Volume 216

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems @257a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems @257a *//
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur mi bgyid /
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur mi bgyid /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who do not attend on the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par mi bgyid la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par mi bgyid la /
translated: who do not complete the wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma bzung bar gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis kyang yongs su ma bzung bar gyur na /
translated: If they are not taken hold of by a spiritual friend,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: will those bodhisattva great beings not attain the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who have not served the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas la /
translated: who have not completed the wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung bar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: and who have not been taken hold of by a spiritual friend will not attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur yang byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur yang byas /
translated: They have served the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par byas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang yongs su rdzogs par byas /
translated: they have completed the wholesome roots,🔽and

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la'ang bsten pa byas kyang da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la'ang bsten pa byas kyang da dung rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi nus na /
translated: If, even though they have attended on a spiritual friend, they are still unable to attain the knowledge of all modes,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas /
translated: how much less so if they do not attend on the Buddhas, the Lords,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen lam bsten pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par ma byas / dge ba'i bshes gnyen lam bsten pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: and do not perfect the wholesome roots,🔽and do not attend on a spiritual friend.

original: de ni / gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni / gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @257b sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ming bden pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @257b sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ming bden pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, who wants to stand in the true reality of the name of a Bodhisattva, and who wants to know full enlightenment quickly, should attend on the Buddhas, the Lords,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po bskyed par bya'o //
translated: and should plant wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on a spiritual friend.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said:

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyis /
translated: “Subhūti, why is it that a bodhisattva great being does not attain omniscience even though he or she serves the lord buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed /
translated: accumulates the wholesome roots,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bgyis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bgyis kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: and relies on spiritual friends?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: de ni / thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni / thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: “It is because he or she is not endowed with skillful means.

original: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de thos par ma gyur pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu'ang ma bskyed /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las thabs de thos par ma gyur pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu'ang ma bskyed /
translated: Because he or she has not heard from those lord buddhas the skillful means, he or she has not accumulated the wholesome roots.

original: gang de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu dag la'ang ma bsten pas /
analyzed: gang de la thabs ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de lta bu dag la'ang ma bsten pas /
translated: Because he or she has not relied on the spiritual friends who teach the skillful means,

original: de ltar thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he or she does not attain it.”🔽Subhūti said:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa de gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa gang dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs mkhas pa de gang lags /
translated: What is the skillful means that a bodhisattva great being should have, so that they will attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems @258a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems @258a *//
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dang po bskyed pas nas nye bar bzung ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: dang po bskyed pas nas nye bar bzung ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: “Subhūti, here, starting from the first production of the thought, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas /
translated: with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / mi dang mi ma yin par gyur pa dag la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / mi dang mi ma yin par gyur pa dag la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ste /
translated: give gifts to the lord buddhas, the pratyekabuddhas, the śrāvakas, and to humans and nonhumans.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dag dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba de dag dang ldan pas /
translated: With those attentions connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin pa la'ang sbyin pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
translated: they do not have the notion of giving with regard to giving,

original: len pa la'ang len pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: len pa la'ang len pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not have the notion of taking with regard to taking,

original: gtong ba la'ang gtong pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtong ba la'ang gtong pa'i 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and he does not have the notion of giving with regard to giving.

original: de ni / 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
analyzed: de ni / 'di ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong par shes shing /
translated: Because he knows that all phenomena are empty of their own marks,

original: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong /🔽chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong / chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug na'ang chos thams cad ni /
translated: and he sees that all phenomena are nonexistent, unarisen, unceased, and unproduced.

original: nus pa gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa gang yang med pa'o //
translated: When he engages with the marks of phenomena, he engages with the mark of the nonexistence of all phenomena.

original: zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'du byed med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jug ste /
translated: He engages with the mark of the nonexistence of all phenomena by way of the mark of the nonexistence of all phenomena.

original: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na /🔽dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: de thabs mkhas pa de lta bu dang ldan pas na / dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: Endowed with such skillful means,🔽he practices the perfection of generosity while increasing his wholesome roots.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: While practicing the perfection of generosity, he brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byad kyang gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs @258b su smin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyod par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byad kyang gzhan du na sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / sems can yongs @258b su smin par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma gtogs par sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gang 'khor bar yongs su spyod par bya ba de lta bu'i 'bras bu la smon pa med do //
translated: Even though they purify a buddhafield, except for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and bringing sentient beings to full maturity, they do not aspire to any result of their generosity that would be enjoyed in cyclic existence.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,

original: le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu rtsa drug pa'o ////
translated: this is chapter fifty-six.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas tshul khrims bsrung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas tshul khrims bsrung ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of morality, from the time when they first begin setting their mind on enlightenment until they are seated in the knower’s seat, they guard morality with a mind that is supported by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur /🔽gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi sems sgrib par mi 'gyur / zhe sdang sgrib par mi 'gyur / gti mug sgrib par mi 'gyur /
translated: in that case, the mind of desire will not be obscured,🔽the mind of hatred will not be obscured,

original: bag la nyal ba sgrib par mi 'gyur /

analyzed: chos thams cad med pa dang / ma byung ba dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par ma grub par mthong ste /

analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: While practicing the perfection of discipline, they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

translated: Although they purify a buddhafield, except for the sake of protecting all sentient beings and bringing sentient beings to full maturity, they do not aspire to any fruit of their discipline that they would enjoy in cyclic existence.

original: le'u lnga bcu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u lnga bcu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifty-seventh chapter, “The Perfection of Discipline,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

translated: Subhūti, furthermore, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of patience, starting from the first production of the thought, cultivate patience with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of perseverance, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment, they should exert themselves with perseverance, their minds imbued with omniscience.

translated: and refines the buddha realms. However, except for practicing the perfection of effort in order to protect all sentient beings and bring sentient beings to full maturity, he does not aspire to any result of effort that would be enjoyed in saṃsāra.

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas bsam gtan rnams la snyoms
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of concentration, from the first production of the thought of awakening onwards, they enter into the concentrations with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of concentration, from the first production of the thought of awakening onwards, they enter into the concentrations with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.
